meanings.definition: To establish vegetation on (a piece of land) again.
meanings.sent1: After the fire, they are revegetating the forest to help it grow back.
meanings.sent2: The conservationists are revegetating the meadow to bring back the native plants.
meanings.sent3: The gardener joked that he was revegetating the lawn after the lawnmower mishap.
meanings.sent4: The community is revegetating the park, turning it into a green oasis.
meanings.sent5: By revegetating the hillside, they are giving new life to the barren land.

meanings.definition: The process of restoring vegetation to an area that has been disturbed or damaged.
meanings.sent1: The company's main focus is the revegetating of the mining site to promote environmental recovery.
meanings.sent2: Revegetating is essential in areas affected by construction to prevent erosion.
meanings.sent3: The school project on revegetating the school garden was a fun learning experience.
meanings.sent4: The community's commitment to revegetating the park shows their dedication to nature.
meanings.sent5: The success of the revegetating project brought back the beauty of the landscape.
